intro: Parosela puberula, commonly known as the hairy parosela, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine regions. Its leaves are finely divided and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Parosela puberula is often found in moist, shaded areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal in horticulture.
